00021 #include "Common/Compat.h"

00030 using namespace Hypertable;
00031 using namespace std;

00033 namespace {

00035   const char *usage = 
00036     "\n"
00037     "  usage: apache_log_query <row-prefix> [ <cf> ... ]\n"
00038     "\n"
00039     "  Queries the table 'LogDb' for all rows that start\n"
00040     "  with <row-prefix>.  If no column families are\n"
00041     "  specified, then all column families are returned.\n"
00042     "  Otherwise, just the column families specified by\n"
00043     "  the <cf> arguments are returned\n";
00044 }
00045 
00052 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00053   ClientPtr client_ptr;
00054   TablePtr table_ptr;
00055   TableScannerPtr scanner_ptr;
00056   ScanSpecBuilder scan_spec_builder;
00057   Cell cell;
00058   String end_row;
00059 
00060   if (argc <= 1) { 
00061     cout << usage << endl;
00062     return 0;
00063   }
00064 
00065   try {
00066 
00067     // Create Hypertable client object
00068     client_ptr = new Client( System::locate_install_dir(argv[0]) );
00069 
00070     // Open the 'LogDb' table
00071     table_ptr = client_ptr->open_table("LogDb");
00072 
00073     // setup row interval
00074     end_row = (String)argv[1];
00075     end_row.append(1, 0xff);  // next minimum row
00076     scan_spec_builder.add_row_interval(argv[1], true, end_row, false);
00077 
00078     // setup scan_spec columns
00079     for (int i=2; i<argc; i++)
00080       scan_spec_builder.add_column(argv[i]);
00081 
00082     // Create a scanner on the 'LogDb' table 
00083     scanner_ptr = table_ptr->create_scanner(scan_spec_builder.get());
00084 
00085   }
00086   catch (std::exception &e) {
00087     cerr << "error: " << e.what() << endl;
00088     return 1;
00089   }
00090 
00091   // Iterate through the cells returned by the scanner
00092   while (scanner_ptr->next(cell)) {
00093     printf("%s\t%s", cell.row_key, cell.column_family);
00094     if (*cell.column_qualifier)
00095       printf(":%s", cell.column_qualifier);
00096     printf("\t%s\n", std::string((const char *)cell.value, cell.value_len).c_str());
00097   }
00098 
00099   return 0;
00100 }
